data.title: Damian Chong Qui - 2020-21 - Men's Basketball
data.meta_description: Damian Chong Qui (15) G  - 2020-21 SEASON:  Started all 23 games for the Mount, averaging 15.1 points, 5.3 assists and 4.2 rebounds per game...Named First Team All-Northeast
data.text:
2020-21 SEASON: Started all 23 games for the Mount, averaging 15.1 points, 5.3 assists and 4.2 rebounds per game...Named First Team All-Northeast Conference...Won NEC Player of the Week honors three times during the season...Scored in double figures 19 times during the season, including a career-best 30 points at Central Connecticut...Scored 20 or more points four times during the season...Had a flair for the dramatic, hitting clutch shots in the final seconds multiple times during the year...Nailed a three-pointer to force overtime with 5.5 seconds left in regulation in the Mount's win at Saint Francis U....Hit a game-tying three-pointer in the final seconds at FDU to force overtime as well...Recorded first career double-double with 10 points and 10 assists in win over Merrimack...Dished out five or more assists on 11 different occasions...Had 21 points and eight rebounds in the Mount's NEC Championship game victory over Bryant...Named to the NEC All-Tournament team...Had 14 points and 11 rebounds in win at Fairleigh Dickinson for second double-double of the year...Shot 37-for-110 (.336) from three-point range on the season...Hit 90-of-112 (.804) at the foul line.

2019-20 SEASON: Had breakout sophomore season for the Mountaineers...Named the Northeast Conference's Most Improved Player while earning Third Team All-NEC honors...Averaged 12.2 points, 3.9 assists, 3.9 rebounds and 1.0 steals per game...Shot 40.9 percent overall and 36.6 percent from three-point range...Shot 126-for-150 (.840) at the foul line...Scored in double figures 20 times during the season...Had 18 points and seven assists in the Mount's NEC Quarterfinal loss at Sacred Heart...Scored career-high 26 points while adding five rebounds and four assists in double-overtime victory against Long Island...Had 23 points and seven boards in overtime loss at Grand Canyon...Had nine points, nine rebounds and three assists in home win over NEC regular season champion Merrimack...Dished out career-est nine assists while adding 13 points in win at Long Island...Had 18 points in home win over Long Island...Had five or more assists 11 times during the season...Dished out 125 assists while committing just 61 turnovers on the year...Averaged 34.1 minutes per game.

2018-19 SEASON: Appeared in all 31 games for the Mount while starting the final 24...Averaged 6.8 points, 3.7 assists and 2.8 rebounds per game...Upped those averages to 8.4 points, 4.4 assists and 3.5 rebounds in NEC play...Had a 2.3-to-1 assist-to-turnover ratio...Scored in double figures on nine occasions...Had five or more assists in a game 13 times his freshman year...Scored two points in 14 minutes in collegiate debut at NC State...Dished out six assists at Marshall...Made first collegiate start at St. John’s and finished with 10 points and five assists in 33 minutes of action...Contributed 11 points and six assists in 30 minutes against Lehigh...Scored 13 points for the Mount at Saint Francis U...Followed with 13 points at Robert Morris...Scored all of his career-best 17 points in the second half of the Mount’s 66-59 loss to Bryant...Chipped in 11 points and seven assists in 77-68 home loss to Central Connecticut...Had 12 points, hitting 5-of-7 from the field, in 70-56 win at Wagner...Stuffed stat sheet with 11 points, career-high eight rebounds and six assists in 79-66 win at Central Connecticut...Posted 15 points, four rebounds and four assists at Bryant...Named Northeast Conference Rookie of the Week after averaging 13.0 points, 6.0 rebounds and 5.0 assists against CCSU and Bryant...Had season-high eight assists while adding five points and five rebounds in come-from-behind win at St. Francis Brooklyn.

HIGH SCHOOL: Named First Team All-Conference as a senior.
